thread.title: Tom’s tips: Volleyball, soccer, tennis highlight week

title: Tom’s tips: Volleyball, soccer, tennis highlight week
text:
Tom’s tips: Volleyball, soccer, tennis highlight week Rocori closes in on CLC title; soccer and girls tennis playoffs are in full gear Post to Facebook Tom’s tips: Volleyball, soccer, tennis highlight week Rocori closes in on CLC title; soccer and girls tennis playoffs are in full gear Check out this story on sctimes.com: http://www.sctimes.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/10/toms-tips-volleyball-soccer-tennis-highlight-week/73738470/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Tom’s tips: Volleyball, soccer, tennis highlight week Tom Elliott , telliott@stcloudtimes.com 3:42 p.m. CDT October 10, 2015 Tom Elliott (Photo: Times photo) 
Rocori is closing in on a Central Lakes Conference volleyball title and Sauk Rapids is playing well. 
The two meet at 7 p.m. Monday at Sauk Rapids. 
Rocori is 9-0 in the CLC, 18-1 overall and seeking its second straight conference championship and fifth since 2003. Sauk Rapids is 5-4 in the conference and 8-7 overall. 
The Storm are led by Kyra Harvey and Alisa Watson. They’ve lost to Rocori twice this season, once in the Sauk Rapids tournament. 
It’s the start of a busy week, not only for Rocori and Sauk Rapids, but for all prep sports. 
There’s prep football playoffs Tuesday, Wednesday and Saturday. 
There is no school Thursday and Friday because of Education Minnesota! meetings in the Twin Cities. 
That means Thursday’s a big volleyball day at Sartell. The Sabres are host to their own invitational and have Foley and St. Cloud Cathedral coming as well as Hibbing, Maple Grove, Mound Westonka and St. Louis Park in the all-day tournament. 
And, the boys and girls soccer playoffs get under way Thursday. By Saturday, everyone will have played at least one match. Those seeds should be set over the weekend. 
A quick look at the schedule: 
Tuesday 
• St. Cloud Tech Invitational cross country meet, 4:30 p.m. at Boulder Ridge Golf Club. 
The location is changed for this huge meet, which includes St. Cloud Apollo, Sartell, Sauk Rapids, Cathedral and Little Falls as well as teams from Brainerd, Forest Lake, Rogers and Princeton. In the past, it has been run at Oak Hill Community School. 
Friday 
• Section 8-2A girls tennis championships, noon at Fitness Evolution, Sartell. 
This is the first of two days as it is determined who is headed to the state meet. The team championship is wrapped up Friday. Tech’s the South Sub-Section 8-2A top seed. Thief River Falls is No. 1 in the North. The championship match is scheduled for 6 p.m. The individual tournament is Saturday. 
The top team and the top two singles players and top two doubles teams advance to the state Class 2A meet Oct 27-30 at the University of Minnesota’s Baseline Tennis Center in Minneapolis. 
This is the opinion of Times prep sports coordinator Tom Elliott. Contact him at 259-3661 or at telliott@scloudtimes.com. Follow him on Facebook or on Twitter @sctimestom. Participate in his live web chat at noon Thursday and listen to the Central Minnesota Prep Sports podcast Thursday afternoons at www.sctimes.com. 3 CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://www.sctimes.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/10/toms-tips-volleyball-soccer-tennis-highlight-week/73738470/ TOP VIDEOS
